name: Subscriber
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber
description: Subscriber object used to stream and process messages from a Subscription. See Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Subscription#listen

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"

subscriber = sub.listen do |received_message|
  # process message
  received_message.acknowledge!
end

# Start background threads that will call the block passed to listen.
subscriber.start

# Shut down the subscriber when ready to stop receiving messages.
subscriber.stop.wait!

methods.name: subscription_name
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#subscription_name
methods.description: The name of the subscription the messages are pulled from.

methods.name: callback
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#callback
methods.description: The procedure that will handle the messages received from the subscription.

methods.name: deadline
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#deadline
methods.description: The default number of seconds the stream will hold received messages before modifying the messageâ€™s ack deadline. The minimum is 10, the maximum is 600. Default is 60.

methods.name: streams
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#streams
methods.description: The number of concurrent streams to open to pull messages from the subscription. Default is 4.

methods.name: inventory
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#inventory
methods.description: The number of received messages to be collected by subscriber. Default is 1,000.

methods.name: callback_threads
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#callback_threads
methods.description: The number of threads used to handle the received messages. Default is 8.

methods.name: push_threads
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#push_threads
methods.description: The number of threads to handle acknowledgement (ReceivedMessage#ack!) and delay messages (ReceivedMessage#nack!, ReceivedMessage#delay!). Default is 4.

methods.name: start
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#start
methods.description: Starts the subscriber pulling from the subscription and processing the received messages.

returns.description: returns self so calls can be chained.

methods.name: stop
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#stop
methods.description: Begins the process of stopping the subscriber. Unhandled received messages will be processed, but no new messages will be pulled from the subscription. Use #wait! to block until the subscriber is fully stopped and all received messages have been processed.

returns.description: returns self so calls can be chained.

methods.name: wait!
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#wait!
methods.description: Blocks until the subscriber is fully stopped and all received messages have been handled. Does not stop the subscriber. To stop the subscriber, first call #stop and then call #wait! to block until the subscriber is stopped.

returns.description: returns self so calls can be chained.

methods.name: on_error
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#on_error
methods.description:
Register to be notified of errors when raised.

If an unhandled error has occurred the subscriber will attempt to recover from the error and resume listening.

Multiple error handlers can be added.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"

subscriber = sub.listen do |received_message|
  # process message
  received_message.acknowledge!
end

# Register to be notified when unhandled errors occur.
subscriber.on_error do |error|
  # log error
  puts error
end

# Start listening for messages and errors.
subscriber.start

# Shut down the subscriber when ready to stop receiving messages.
subscriber.stop.wait!

params.name: yield
params.description: The block to be called when an error is raised.

methods.name: last_error
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Subscriber#last_error
methods.description:
The most recent unhandled error to occur while listening to messages on the subscriber.

If an unhandled error has occurred the subscriber will attempt to recover from the error and resume listening.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"

subscriber = sub.listen do |received_message|
  # process message
  received_message.acknowledge!
end

# Start listening for messages and errors.
subscriber.start

# If an error was raised, it can be retrieved here:
subscriber.last_error #=> nil

# Shut down the subscriber when ready to stop receiving messages.
subscriber.stop.wait!

returns.description: error The most recent error raised.
